intro: Anacampseros somaliensis, commonly known as the Somali stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves that help it survive in dry environments. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to high levels of sunlight. Its compact growth habit and ability to form dense mats make it well-suited for xerophytic conditions. Anacampseros somaliensis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
